radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple calcified nodular opacities that were less than 5 mm in diameter scattered throughout the lungs.
Nodular opacities consistent with granulomas; the lungs, heart, and mediastinum were otherwise normal. Mild thickening of the distal esophagus.
Gastric mucosal erythema, a hiatal hernia, Barrett’s esophagus with a single esophageal nodule located 35 cm from the incisors.
Intramucosal carcinoma arising in high-grade dysplasia confirmed; high-grade dysplasia extended to the lateral margin.

radiographic_examinations.date: Two days after receiving porfimer sodium
radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderately severe esophagitis within the treated segment, although changes were not uniform.

radiographic_examinations.date: Several follow-up visits after photodynamic therapy
radiographic_examinations.findings: Esophagus lined by squamous mucosa; several small patches of Barrett’s epithelium apparent.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Dysphagia and hiccups developed, followed by balloon dilation of a benign stenosis. At 46 months post-treatment, biopsies showed no recurrence of Barrett’s esophagus or dysplasia.
